item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of a New Output Relay and a GND Switch
item.description:

item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a New Gold Coated DIN5 Plug and a Grounding Switch
item.description:
My restoration of the Beogram 4000 is progressing well. I’ve added a grounding switch and a new gold-plated Neutrik DIN5 plug. The switch allows users to choose between the grounding setup of the older 4000/4002 models (separate signal and system grounds) and the later 4004 models (combined grounds). This option helps prevent ground loops and the resulting humming, depending on the amplifier being used. I wrote a detailed post on this topic a while back...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5514): RPM Performance Measurement after Restoration of DC Motor and Control System
item.description:
Following the restoration of a Beogram 4002 (5514) turntable’s DC motor and control system, a 24-hour RPM performance test was conducted using a custom-built RPM monitoring device. The initial performance, measured before the restoration, revealed noticeable, abrupt drops in RPM, indicating typical wear and tear in the DC motor’s brass sleeve bearings.
